item.title: Moment Generating Functions
item.description: What’s a moment generating function? How’s it used in stats?

item.title: Zulu Article | Uzoqhubeka asebenzele ekhaya uMantashe osuleleke ngeCovid-19
Hitchhiker's Guides
item.description: I’ve started preparing these guides across various topics. I’ve done this at some of the places I’ve worked, and they seem pretty useful. I use these as a handy reference to technical topics. Guides: The Hitchhiker’s Guide to Inferential Statistics

item.title: The Hitchikers Guide to Inferential Statistics
ISLR Notes
item.description:
Just a place for me to keep my notes of the Introduction to Statistical Learning book.

This is by no means a comprehensive summary; just a list of points I wish to remember.

item.title: An R Pipeline for XGBoost (and a discussion about hyperparameters)
item.description:
In this blog post, we discuss what XGBoost is, and demonstrate a pipeline for working with XGBoost in R.

bkaswd

item.title: Work Rules! - Insights from Inside Google That Will Transform How You Live and Lead, Part 1
item.description:
Hello Person From The Internet who has decided to come here. Thank you for dropping by.

Today I’m going to talk about a book I read - Work Rules!: Insights from Inside Google That Will Transform How You Live and Lead by Laszlo Bock.

item.title: r-pca
item.description: Principal Components Analysis (PCA) is a commonly used dimensionality reduction algorithm. In this post, we show how to perform PCA in R. This post will only briefly touch on the theory behind PCA; instead, we focus on intuition, implementation and interpretation.

item.title: An Introduction to H2O Using R
item.description: In this post we discuss the H2O machine learning platform. We talk about what H2O is, and how to get started with it, using R - we create a Random Forest which we use to classify the Iris Dataset.

item.title: Inverse Matrices - A Primer
item.description: In this post we talk about the inverse matrix. We discuss what it means for a matrix to be invertible. We then discuss what it means for a matrix not to be invertible - singular. Finally, we briefly go through how to find a matrix’s inverse.

item.title: Rank of a Matrix
item.description: The dimension of the column space of a matrix is called its rank.

item.title: A Matrix Nullspace (Kernel) Tutorial - Finding the Nullspace
item.description: In this article we describe what the nullspace is. We go on to explain how to find the nullspace.

item.title: Of Matrices and Men (pt. 2)
item.description: In my last post we saw how a matrix could operate on a vector to produce a result…

item.title: Of Matrices and Men (pt. 1)
item.description: One of the most crucial changes in my viewpoint came when I learned that matrices, much like functions, act on inputs. Until then, a matrix was just a collection of numbers and matrix multiplication was just a mechanical set of rules used to produce another collection of numbers. I knew that the result of matrix multiplication could be a scalar, a vector or another matrix… but I abandoned any further investigations.

item.title: Hi There. This is my first post. Or: Linear Algebra, bra?
item.description: I need a place to document my various ideas as well as the potential results of those ideas.
A few blogs which I like: R Bloggers Machine Learning, Software and Computer Vision

Erm.. Yeah, so this is a place for me to keep track of what I've been reading.
